revised_title: Experiments on Dying Black: The Role of Lime and Alkalis in Dyeing
tldr: James Clegg investigates the effects of lime and alkalis on the dyeing process, particularly in the creation of black dyes. He discovers that while lime can deepen the color produced by some astringents, it does not improve colorfastness and can even destroy the dyeing properties of logwood. Clegg also finds that the use of alkalis, such as pearl ashes, can produce deeper black colors, but excessive amounts can damage the colorfastness of the dyes.
